title: What Happened to Disney’s Florida ‘Stakeholders’?
sub_head: Businesses that claim to have a greater purpose than serving shareholders often end up serving a lesser political agenda.
body:
If there’s any good to come from the Walt Disney Company’s opposition to Florida’s new parental rights law, it may be in helping to expose the misleading promises of the “corporate social responsibility” movement.
A Journal editorial notes the eminently reasonable language of the new Florida law that Disney executives cannot abide:
